meanings.definition: To fill or pack again with material.
meanings.sent1: I need to restuff my pillow with more feathers.
meanings.sent2: She decided to restuff the teddy bear to make it fluffy again.
meanings.sent3: After the pillow fight, we had to restuff the pillows for the next round.
meanings.sent4: The baker had to restuff the pastry with more cream to make it delicious.
meanings.sent5: The scarecrow needed to restuff its straw to scare away the birds effectively.

meanings.definition: To add stuffing or padding back into something.
meanings.sent1: The couch was uncomfortable, so she had to restuff it with more foam.
meanings.sent2: He had to restuff the cushion after it lost its shape.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought it was a game when we tried to restuff its toy.
meanings.sent4: She had to restuff the jacket to keep herself warm in the winter.
meanings.sent5: The old chair needed to be restuffed to make it comfortable to sit on again.
